perturbation.original_text: Floating Rate Payer Payment      Delayed  Payment shall be applicable.  The Dates:                           FloatingRate  Payer  Payment  Dates  shall be                                  two  Business Days prior to 25 January, 25                                  February, 25 March, 25 April, 25 May, 25 June,                                  25 July, 25 August, 25 September, 25 October,                                  25 November and 25 December, in each year, from                                  and including 25 May 2006, up to and including                                  25 April 2009, notwithstanding the specified &bbsp;                                Termination Date, subject to adjustment in                                  accordance with the Business Day Convention                                  specified immediately below.
perturbation.changed_text:
Floating Rate Payer Payment      Delayed  Payment shall be applicable.  The Dates:                           FloatingRate  Payer  Payment  Dates  shall be                                  two  Business Days prior to 25 January, 25                                  February, 25 March, 25 April, 25 May, 25 June,                                  25 July, 25 August, 25 September, 25 October,                                  25 November and 25 December, in each year, from                                  and including 25 May 2006, up to and including                                  25 April 2009, notwithstanding the specified                                Termination Date, subject to adjustment in                                  accordance with the Business Day Convention                                  specified immediately below.

Notwithstanding the above, in the event of Counterparty's failure to deliver documentation required under Section 4(a)(i) and (ii) within five (5) Business Days of reasonable demand, Floating Rate Payer Payment Dates shall be five Business Days prior to the aforementioned dates.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by adding a clause that alters the Floating Rate Payer Payment Dates under specific conditions (Counterparty failing to deliver documentation). This contradicts the previously stated fixed payment dates, creating uncertainty in enforcement.
perturbation.location: General Terms - Floating Amounts - Floating Rate Payer Payment Dates

perturbation.original_text: (xvii)  The ISDA Form is hereby amended as follows: for the purposes of this         Transaction, the word "third" shall be replaced by he word "first" in         the third line of Section 5(a)(i) of the ISDA Form; provided, however,         that notwithstanding the foregoing, an Event of Default shall not occur         under either if, as demonstrated to the reasonable satisfaction of the         other party, (a) the failure to pay or deliver is caused by an error or         omission of an administrative or operational nature; and (b) funds or         the relevant instrument were available to such party to enable it to         make the relevant payment or delivery when due; and (c) such relevant         payment is made within the earlier of (a) three Business Days following         receipt of written notice from an the other party of such failure to pay         or (b) 12:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time on the Distribution Date (as         defined in the Pooling and Servicing Agreement) immediately following         the failure to pay.
perturbation.changed_text:
(xvii)  The ISDA Form is hereby amended as follows: for the purposes of this         Transaction, the word "third" shall be replaced by he word "first" in         the third line of Section 5(a)(i) of the ISDA Form; provided, however,         that notwithstanding the foregoing, an Event of Default shall not occur         under either if, as demonstrated to the reasonable satisfaction of the         other party, (a) the failure to pay or deliver is caused by an error or         omission of an administrative or operational nature; and (b) funds or         the relevant instrument were available to such party to enable it to         make the relevant payment or delivery when due; and (c) such relevant         payment is made within the earlier of (a) three Business Days following         receipt of written notice from an the other party of such failure to pay or (b) 12:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time on the Distribution Date (as         defined in the Pooling and Servicing Agreement) immediately following         the failure to pay.

Notwithstanding the above grace period, any failure to pay by UBS AG will result in an immediate Event of Default, regardless of the reason or availability of funds.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause provides a grace period for payments due to administrative errors if funds are available. The added text directly contradicts this by stating any failure to pay by UBS AG immediately triggers an Event of Default, removing the grace period and creating uncertainty regarding when a failure to pay constitutes a default.

perturbation.original_text:
Each party will be deemed to represent to the other party on the date on which it enters into this Transaction that (in the absence of a written agreement between the parties which expressly imposes affirmative obligations to the contrary for this Transaction):

(a) Non-Reliance. Each party is acting for its own account, and has made its own independent decisions to enter into this Transaction and this Transaction is appropriate or proper for it based upon its own judgment and upon advice from such advisers as it has deemed necessary. Each party is not relying on any communication (written or oral) of the other party as investment advice or as a recommendation to enter into this Transaction; it being understood that information and explanation relating to the terms and conditions of this Transaction shall not be considered investment advice or a recommendation to enter into this Transaction. No communication (written or oral) received from the other party shall be deemed to be an assurance or guarantee as to the expected results of this Transaction.
perturbation.changed_text:
Each party will be deemed to represent to the other party on the date on which it enters into this Transaction that (in the absence of a written agreement between the parties which expressly imposes affirmative obligations to the contrary for this Transaction):

(a) Non-Reliance. Each party is acting for its own account, and has made its own independent decisions to enter into this Transaction and this Transaction is appropriate or proper for it based upon its own judgment and upon advice from such advisers as it has deemed necessary. Each party is not relying on any communication (written or oral) of the other party as investment advice or as a recommendation to enter into this Transaction; it being understood that information and explanation relating to the terms and conditions of this Transaction shall not be considered investment advice or a recommendation to enter into this Transaction. No communication (written or oral) received from the other party shall be deemed to be an assurance or guarantee as to the expected results of this Transaction.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, UBS AG acknowledges that Counterparty is relying on UBS AG's expertise and guidance in executing this transaction, and UBS AG shall be held liable for any misrepresentations of the risks of the transaction.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that neither party is relying on the other for investment advice. The added text then contradicts this by stating that Counterparty is relying on UBS AG's expertise and that UBS AG is liable for misrepresentations. This in-text contradiction creates ambiguity regarding the level of reliance and responsibility each party has, potentially leading to disputes about due diligence and liability.
